title: House Democrats Include Provisions Protecting Immigrants
sub_head: Temporary work authorization for immigrants would be included in $1.85 trillion healthcare, education and climate bill; proposal’s fate in Senate is uncertain
body:
WASHINGTON—House Democrats included new protections for immigrants in the country illegally in the revised text of their social spending and climate bill released Wednesday, after several previous proposals hit a dead end in the Senate.
The protections would shield the immigrants from deportation for five years and provide a five-year, renewable work authorization. But a group of Hispanic lawmakers said that the provisions included in the bill wouldn’t open up a pathway to citizenship and need to go further.
